SEARCH
Package com.sympos2.controllers

Class MainRestController

java.lang.Object
com.sympos2.controllers.MainRestController
@RestController @CrossOrigin(origins="http://localhost:5173") public class MainRestController extends Object
This Controller handles the redirections and logic of each front's URL, but the React's front-end templates.
Version:
0.1.0
Author:
KurixDeCuatroCuernos

  • Method Details

    • getNewestWriting

      @GetMapping("/getNewestWriting") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<String> getNewestWriting() throws com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonProcessingException
      This method handles the retrieval of the newest writing (latest work) from the database.

      It fetches the most recent work from the `obraRepo` sorted by its creation date in descending order. The result is then returned as a JSON response, which includes the work details if found, along with a status message indicating success or failure.

      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity containing the status of the request and the newest writing in JSON format.
      Throws:
      com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonProcessingException - If there is an error during the JSON processing of the response.

    • getMostValuedWriting

      @GetMapping("/getMostValuedWriting") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<String> getMostValuedWriting() throws com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonProcessingException
      This method retrieves the most valued writing (work) based on the average rating from the database.

      It fetches all the works from the repository and calculates the average value for each work. The work with the highest average value is considered the most valued and is returned in the JSON response. In case of an error, an appropriate message is included in the response.

      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity containing the status of the request and the most valued writing in JSON format.
      Throws:
      com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonProcessingException - If there is an error during the JSON processing of the response.

    • getTitledComment

      @GetMapping("/getTitledComment") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<String> getTitledComment() throws com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonProcessingException
      This method retrieves the most recent comment that is not from a "STUDENT" user and returns it as a response.

      The method first fetches all the comments of type "COMMENT" and all users with the role "STUDENT". It then removes comments authored by "STUDENT" users from the list. Afterward, the method identifies the newest comment (the one with the latest date) and returns it, along with the user's details (ID, name, and role) in the response. If any exception occurs during the process, an error message is included in the response.

      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity containing the status of the request and the most recent comment (not by "STUDENT") in JSON format.
      Throws:
      com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonProcessingException - If there is an error during the JSON processing of the response.

    • getBanComment

      @GetMapping("/getBanComment") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<String> getBanComment(@RequestParam String id) throws com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonProcessingException
      This method bans a comment or an answer by changing its type to "BANNED_COMMENT" or "BANNED_ANSWER", respectively. It receives the ID of the comment or answer, finds the corresponding entity, and updates its type to mark it as banned.

      If the comment or answer is found, the method changes its type to "BANNED_COMMENT" for comments or "BANNED_ANSWER" for answers and saves the updated entity. If the provided ID does not correspond to a valid comment or answer, or if there is an error during the operation, an appropriate error message is included in the response.

      Parameters:
      id - The ID of the comment or answer to be banned.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity containing the status of the request and a message, in JSON format.
      Throws:
      com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonProcessingException - If there is an error during the JSON processing of the response.

    • getAllBanComments

      @GetMapping("/getAllBanComments") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<String> getAllBanComments() throws com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonProcessingException
      This method retrieves all banned comments and answers from the database and returns them in a response. It fetches comments with type "BANNED_COMMENT" and answers with type "BANNED_ANSWER". For each banned comment or answer, it retrieves the associated user details and creates a response object that includes the comment/answer along with user information (ID, username, and role).

      If there are any banned comments or answers, the method constructs an array of `ComentarioPintado` objects, which contain both the comment and its associated user details. If no banned comments or answers are found, the response will indicate "false".

      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity containing a JSON object with the status of the request and the list of banned comments or answers, or an error message if an exception occurs during the process.
      Throws:
      com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonProcessingException - If there is an error during the JSON processing of the response.

    • getDeleteComment

      @GetMapping("/getDelComment") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<String> getDeleteComment(@RequestParam String id) throws com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonProcessingException
      This method deletes a comment (and its associated answers, if any) from the database. It first checks if the provided comment ID has any associated answers. If answers exist, those are also deleted before deleting the original comment.

      The process works as follows: - If the provided comment ID is not null, the method looks for all answers related to the comment. - If answers exist, they are deleted from the database. - Afterward, the original comment is deleted as well.

      The response will indicate the success or failure of the deletion process. If an exception is thrown, it is caught and an error message is returned. If no ID is provided, a message indicating that the ID was not received will be returned.

      Parameters:
      id - The ID of the comment to be deleted.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity containing a JSON object with the status of the deletion operation. If the operation is successful, it will return a status of "true". If an error occurs, it will return a status of "false" with an error message.
      Throws:
      com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonProcessingException - If there is an error during the JSON processing of the response.

    • getUnbanComment

      @GetMapping("/getUnbanComment") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<String> getUnbanComment(@RequestParam String id) throws com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonProcessingException
      This method unbans a previously banned comment or answer by changing its type back to "COMMENT" or "ANSWER".

      The process works as follows: - If the provided comment ID is not null, the method tries to find the comment with the given ID. - If the comment is found and it is banned (i.e., its type is "BANNED_COMMENT" or "BANNED_ANSWER"), the method changes its type back to "COMMENT" or "ANSWER" respectively. - If the comment is not banned or does not exist, an appropriate message is returned in the response.

      The response indicates whether the unban operation was successful or not. If an exception occurs during the process, it is captured and returned as an error message. If no ID is provided, a message indicating that the ID was not received will be returned.

      Parameters:
      id - The ID of the comment or answer to be unbanned.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity containing a JSON object with the status of the unban operation. If the operation is successful, it will return a status of "true". If an error occurs, it will return a status of "false" with an error message.
      Throws:
      com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonProcessingException - If there is an error during the JSON processing of the response.

    • getStudentComment

      @GetMapping("/getStudentComment") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<String> getStudentComment() throws com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonProcessingException
      This method retrieves the most recent comment made by a user with the role "TITLED", excluding comments made by students, and returns it along with the user's information.

      The process works as follows: - The method fetches all comments of type "COMMENT" from the database. - It then fetches a list of users with the role "TITLED" (not students). - The comments made by users with the "STUDENT" role are removed from the list. - The method selects the most recent comment from the remaining comments and fetches the user's information associated with it. - It returns the comment along with the user's ID, name, and role in the response.

      If an error occurs during the process, an appropriate error message is included in the response. If no valid comment is found, a message indicating the failure is returned.

      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity containing a JSON object with the status of the operation and the most recent comment made by a "TITLED" user. If the operation is successful, the comment, along with the user's details, is included in the response. If there is an error, a status of "false" and an error message will be returned.
      Throws:
      com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonProcessingException - If there is an error during the JSON processing of the response.

    • suggestList

      @GetMapping("/sugerencias") public List<ObraIsbnTituloProjection> suggestList(@RequestParam(required=false) String searchTerm)
      This method retrieves a list of book suggestions based on the provided search term. If no search term is provided, it returns all available book suggestions from the repository.

      The method fetches a list of books with their ISBN and title from the repository, and if the list is not empty, it returns the suggestions. If the list is empty, a message is logged indicating that suggestions could not be fetched.

      Parameters:
      searchTerm - An optional search term to filter the book suggestions. If no term is provided, all books are returned.
      Returns:
      A list of ObraIsbnTituloProjection containing the ISBN and title of the books. If no suggestions are found, an empty list is returned.

    • getUserRole

      @GetMapping("/getUserRole") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<String> getUserRole()
      Retrieves the role of the currently authenticated user.

      This method checks if the user is authenticated and if their session is not from an anonymous user. If the user is authenticated, it fetches the user's role from the database and returns it as a JSON response. If the user is not found or there is an error during the process, it returns a JSON response indicating the failure.

      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity containing a JSON response with the user's role. If the user is authenticated, the role is included in the response, otherwise a response with "role": null is returned. In case of an error during serialization, a 500 error with a specific error message is returned.

    • getUserAvatar

      @GetMapping("/getUserAvatar") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<String> getUserAvatar()
      Retrieves the avatar and username of the currently authenticated user.

      This method checks if the user is authenticated. If the user is authenticated and not anonymous, it fetches the user's details (including avatar and username) from the database. The avatar and username are returned as a JSON response. If the user does not have an avatar, a default avatar image URL is provided. If any error occurs during the process or if the user is not authenticated, an appropriate error message is returned.

      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity containing a JSON response with the user's avatar and username. If the user is not authenticated, a bad request response is returned with an error message. If an error occurs while processing the request, a server error response is returned.

    • getUsername

      @GetMapping("/getUsername") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<String> getUsername() throws com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonProcessingException
      Retrieves the username of the currently authenticated user.

      This method checks if the user is authenticated. If the user is authenticated and not anonymous, it attempts to fetch the user's details (name) from the database. If the user exists, the name is returned. If the user is not found in the database, it returns the username from the authentication token. If the user is not authenticated, the response will indicate that the user is not authenticated.

      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity containing a JSON response with the status and the username of the authenticated user. If the user is not authenticated, the response will indicate that the user is not authenticated. The response includes a status key and a user key that contains the username or a "false" value if the user is not authenticated.
      Throws:
      com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonProcessingException - if an error occurs while serializing the response to JSON.

    • loginUser

      @PostMapping("/getLogin") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<String> loginUser(@RequestBody UserRequestBody user) throws com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonProcessingException
      Handles user login by authenticating the provided credentials (email and password).

      This method takes a UserRequestBody object, which contains the user's email and password. It then attempts to authenticate the user by checking the credentials against the database. If the credentials are correct, a session is created, and the user is authenticated. If the credentials are incorrect or if an error occurs, an appropriate message is returned in the response.

      Parameters:
      user - A UserRequestBody object containing the email and password of the user attempting to log in.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity containing a JSON response with the login status: - If authentication is successful, it returns a status of "true". - If authentication fails (wrong email/password), it returns a status of "false" and an error message. - If an internal error occurs, it returns a status of "false" and an error message indicating the problem.
      Throws:
      com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonProcessingException - If there is an error serializing the response to JSON.

    • logoutUser

      @PostMapping("/getLogout") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<String> logoutUser(jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request, jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
      Logs out the current authenticated user by invalidating the HTTP session and clearing the security context.

      This method invalidates the user's session and clears the security context, effectively logging the user out of the application. It handles any internal errors during the logout process by returning an error message. If the logout is successful, it returns a confirmation message.

      Parameters:
      request - The HttpServletRequest object used to retrieve the current session.
      response - The HttpServletResponse object, which is not used directly in this method but is included as part of the signature.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity containing a string message indicating the result of the logout attempt: - "Logout exitoso" if the user has been logged out successfully. - "Error al cerrar sesión" if there is an error during the logout process.

    • getWriting

      @GetMapping("/getWriting") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<String> getWriting(@RequestParam Long id) throws com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonProcessingException
      Retrieves a work (Obra) by its ID and returns its details in a JSON format.

      This method takes the ID of a work and attempts to retrieve its corresponding data from the database. It returns various details about the work, including its title, author, publication date, place of publication, publisher, type, abstract, and average rating. If the work is an article, the page range is also included. The response is formatted as a JSON object containing the work's data or an error message if the work is not found.

      Parameters:
      id - The ID of the work (Obra) to be retrieved.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity containing a JSON object with the following: - If the work is found, the work's details, including title, author, publication date, and other relevant fields. - If the work is not found, a message indicating that the work with the given ID was not found. - Error messages in case of issues during the retrieval process or if the ID is not provided.
      Throws:
      com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonProcessingException

    • getComentarios

      @GetMapping("/getComentarios") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<String> getComentarios(@RequestParam Long id, @RequestParam String role) throws com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonProcessingException
      Retrieves comments for a specific work (Obra) filtered by user role and ordered by date.

      This method takes an ID of a work (Obra) and a user role as parameters. It fetches all comments associated with the given work, filtering them based on the role of the user who made the comment. The comments are sorted in descending order by their date of creation. If comments are found, it returns a JSON response with the details of each comment, including the title, text, date, rating, username, school, and role of the user who posted the comment. If no comments are found or an error occurs, appropriate error messages are returned.

      Parameters:
      id - The ID of the work (Obra) whose comments are to be retrieved.
      role - The role of the user whose comments are to be filtered (e.g., "STUDENT", "TITLED").
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity containing a JSON object with the following: - If comments are found, a list of comments including their details (title, text, date, etc.). - If no comments are found, a message indicating that no comments exist for the given work. - Error messages if issues occur during data retrieval or processing.
      Throws:
      com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonProcessingException

    • getAnswers

      @GetMapping("/getAnswers") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<String> getAnswers(@RequestParam Long id, @RequestParam String comment) throws com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonProcessingException
      Retrieves all answers associated with a specific comment for a particular work (Obra).

      This method takes the ID of a work (Obra) and a specific comment ID as parameters. It fetches all responses (answers) to the given comment for the specified work, sorted in descending order by the date they were created. The responses include information such as the title, text, date, rating, username, school, role of the user who posted the answer, and the comment they are answering. If no answers are found or if an error occurs, an appropriate response is returned.

      Parameters:
      id - The ID of the work (Obra) for which answers are being retrieved.
      comment - The ID of the comment to which the answers belong.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity containing a JSON object with: - An array of answers with their details (title, text, date, rating, username, school, role, and original comment). - If no answers are found, an empty array is returned. - Error messages if any issues arise during data retrieval or processing.
      Throws:
      com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonProcessingException

    • getCommented

      @GetMapping("/getCommented") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<String> getCommented(Long id, String user)
      Checks whether a specific user has commented on a particular work (Obra).

      This method searches for comments made by the specified user for a given work (Obra). It checks if any of the comments made by the user are of type "COMMENT". If a comment of this type is found, the response will indicate that the user has commented on the work, otherwise, it will indicate that the user has not commented. The response is returned as a JSON object containing a single key-value pair: "commented" with a value of "true" or "false".

      Parameters:
      id - The ID of the work (Obra) to search for comments.
      user - The username of the user whose comments are being checked.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity containing a JSON object with the key "commented" and a value of either "true" or "false", indicating whether the user has commented on the work. If an error occurs during the operation, a 500 error with an appropriate message is returned.

    • getUserId

      @GetMapping("/getUserIdent") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<String> getUserId() throws com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonProcessingException
      Retrieves the ID of the authenticated user.

      This method checks if the current user is authenticated. If the user is authenticated, it fetches the user's ID from the database based on their email (retrieved from the authentication context). If successful, the user's ID is returned in the response. If the user is not authenticated or an error occurs while fetching the user data, an appropriate error message is returned.

      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity containing a JSON object with the user's ID and status: - If the user is authenticated and their ID is found, the response will contain: - `"status": "true"`, `"message": "User found"`, and `"id": ""`. - If the user is not authenticated or there is an error fetching the user, the response will contain: - `"status": "false"` and an appropriate error message.
      Throws:
      com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonProcessingException

    • postCommentInserted

      @PostMapping("/postCommentInserted") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<String> postCommentInserted(@RequestBody Comentario request) throws com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonProcessingException
      Inserts a new comment into the database.

      This method receives a Comentario object via HTTP POST, validates the required fields, and attempts to save it to the database. If all required fields are present and valid, the comment is saved successfully. If any validation fails or an error occurs during the saving process, an appropriate error message is returned.

      The comment can either be a regular comment or an answer. The required fields for each type are as follows:

      • If the comment is of type "COMMENT":
        • `titulo` (title) - Required
        • `texto` (text) - Required
        • `usuario` (user) - Required
        • `obra` (work) - Required
      • If the comment is of type "ANSWER":
        • `texto` (text) - Required
        • `usuario` (user) - Required
        • `obra` (work) - Required
      Parameters:
      request - A Comentario object containing the details of the comment to be inserted. The fields must be provided based on the comment type ("COMMENT" or "ANSWER"). - If the type is "COMMENT", the following fields are required: - `titulo` (title), `texto` (text), `usuario` (user), `obra` (work) - If the type is "ANSWER", the following fields are required: - `texto` (text), `usuario` (user), `obra` (work)
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity containing a JSON object with the status and message: - If the comment is successfully inserted, the response will contain: - `"status": "true"`, `"message": "Datos recibidos con éxito"` - If validation fails or an error occurs during saving, the response will contain: - `"status": "false"` and an appropriate error message.
      Throws:
      com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonProcessingException

    • getIdComment

      @GetMapping("/getIdComment") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<String> getIdComment(@RequestParam Long isbn, @RequestParam String usr) throws com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonProcessingException
      Retrieves the ID of a comment made by a user on a specific work (identified by ISBN).

      This method handles HTTP GET requests and looks for a comment made by a specific user on a work identified by its ISBN. If a comment is found, it returns the ID of the comment. If no comment is found or if an error occurs during the process, an appropriate message is returned.

      Parameters:
      isbn - The ISBN (unique identifier) of the work to look for comments on.
      usr - The username (or user identifier) of the person who made the comment.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity containing a JSON object: - If a comment is found, the JSON will include: - `"status": "true"`, `"idComment": ""`. - If no comment is found or if an error occurs, the JSON will include: - `"status": "false"` and an appropriate error message.
      Throws:
      com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonProcessingException

    • getCommentEdit

      @GetMapping("/getCommentEdit") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<String> getCommentEdit(@RequestParam String id) throws com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonProcessingException
      Retrieves the details of a comment by its ID.

      This method handles HTTP GET requests and searches for a comment in the database using the provided comment ID. If the comment is found, it returns the comment's title, text, and rating. If no comment is found or an error occurs, an appropriate message is returned.

      Parameters:
      id - The ID of the comment to be retrieved.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity containing a JSON object: - If the comment is found, the JSON will include: - `"status": "true"`, `"title": ""`, `"text": ""`, `"value": ""`. - If no comment is found, the JSON will include: - `"status": "false"` and an appropriate error message. - If there is an error in retrieving the comment, the JSON will include: - `"status": "false"` and an error message describing the issue.
      Throws:
      com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonProcessingException

    • postCommentEdited

      @PostMapping("/postCommentEdited") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<String> postCommentEdited(@RequestBody Comentario request) throws com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonProcessingException
      Edits an existing comment in the database.

      This method handles HTTP POST requests and updates an existing comment in the database. It requires the full comment data to be provided, including the title, text, user, and associated work (obra). If the comment is found, it updates its details; if not, an error message is returned.

      Parameters:
      request - The comment object containing the updated details to be saved.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity containing a JSON object: - If the comment is successfully updated: - `"status": "true"`, `"message": "Datos recibidos con éxito"`. - If no comment to edit is found in the database: - `"status": "false"`, `"message": "There wasn't a comment to edit in the database"`. - If there is an error during the update: - `"status": "false"`, `"message": "Error al enviar los datos a la base de datos"`. - If the request data is incomplete or invalid: - `"status": "false"`, `"message": "Error al recibir los datos"`.
      Throws:
      com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonProcessingException

    • getEmails

      @GetMapping("/getEmails") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<String> getEmails(@RequestParam String email) throws com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonProcessingException
      Checks if an email is already registered in the system.

      This method handles HTTP GET requests to check if the provided email is already registered in the system. It validates the format of the email, then searches the database for any existing entries with that email. If the email exists, the response indicates that the email is already registered. Otherwise, the email is available for registration.

      Parameters:
      email - The email address to be checked.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity containing a JSON object with the status and message: - If the email is valid and already registered: - `"status": "true"`, `"checkEmail": "false"`, `"resp": "This email is already registered, try to log-in"`. - If the email is valid and not registered: - `"status": "true"`, `"checkEmail": "true"`. - If the email format is invalid (does not contain "@" or does not end with ".com" or ".es"): - `"status": "true"`, `"checkEmail": "false"`. - If the email is null: - `"status": "false"`, `"message": "The email received is null"`. - If there is an error while searching for emails in the database: - `"status": "false"`, `"message": "Error searching emails in database"`.
      Throws:
      com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonProcessingException

    • getEmailsEdit

      @GetMapping("/getEmailsEdit") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<String> getEmailsEdit(@RequestParam String email, @RequestParam String currentEmail) throws com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonProcessingException
      Checks if an email is already registered, excluding the current email.

      This method handles HTTP GET requests to check if the provided email is already registered in the system, while excluding the user's current email (to allow for email changes). It validates the format of the email, searches the database for any existing entries with that email, and compares it to the current email. If the email exists, the response indicates that the email is already registered. Otherwise, the email is available for registration.

      Parameters:
      email - The email address to be checked.
      currentEmail - The current email of the user, which will be excluded from the check.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity containing a JSON object with the status and message: - If the email is valid and already registered (excluding the current email): - `"status": "true"`, `"checkEmail": "false"`, `"resp": "This email is already registered, try to log-in"`. - If the email is valid and not registered (excluding the current email): - `"status": "true"`, `"checkEmail": "true"`. - If the email format is invalid (does not contain "@" or does not end with ".com" or ".es"): - `"status": "true"`, `"checkEmail": "false"`. - If the email is null: - `"status": "false"`, `"message": "The email received is null"`. - If there is an error while searching for emails in the database: - `"status": "false"`, `"message": "Error searching emails in database"`.
      Throws:
      com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonProcessingException

    • getUserToEdit

      @GetMapping("/getUserToEdit") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<String> getUserToEdit(@RequestParam String id) throws com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonProcessingException
      Retrieves information about a user based on their ID, returning data specific to their role.

      This method handles HTTP GET requests to fetch details of a user, including name, email, birthdate, and role-specific information. The user's role determines what additional data is included: - For "STUDENT" users: studies and school information. - For "TITLED" users: details about their studies and title. - For "ADMIN" users: phone number. If the user cannot be found or if an error occurs during the process, an appropriate error message is returned.

      Parameters:
      id - The unique identifier of the user whose information is to be retrieved.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity containing a JSON object with the status and user details: - If the user is found: - "status": "true", with corresponding user details such as: - "name": User's name. - "email": User's email address. - "fechaNac": User's birthdate. - "role": User's role. - Role-specific data (e.g., "studies", "school", "studiesTitle", etc.). - If the user cannot be found: - "status": "false", "message": "Couldn´t find the user with id: {id}". - If the user has no role: - "status": "false", "message": "The user collected has no role". - If there is an exception while retrieving the user: - "status": "false", "message": "Exception in server getting the user to edit: {exception}".
      Throws:
      com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonProcessingException

    • postUserEdited

      @PostMapping("/postUserEdited") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<String> postUserEdited(@RequestBody Usuario user) throws com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonProcessingException
      Edits an existing user's information by updating their details with the provided data.

      This method handles HTTP POST requests to update the details of an existing user in the system. The user's information is updated based on the data provided in the request body. Fields such as name, password, role, birthdate, email, studies, school, title information, and phone number are updated if they contain valid values. The password, if provided, is encoded before saving. If the user is an "ADMIN", all comments and their related answers made by that user are deleted. After the update, a status message is returned indicating whether the operation was successful or if an error occurred.

      The updated fields are as follows:

      • If the password is provided, it is encoded and updated.
      • If the name, role, email, studies, school, studies title, study place, title date, or phone are provided, they are updated accordingly.
      • If the user's role is "ADMIN", all comments and answers made by that user are deleted from the database.
      Parameters:
      user - A Usuario object containing the updated data for the user. The user object must include the user ID and any fields that need to be updated.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity containing a JSON object with the status of the operation: - If the user is successfully updated: - "status": "true". - If there is an error during the process: - "status": "false", "message": "There was an error editing the user in the server: {error message}".
      Throws:
      com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonProcessingException

    • postRegistryUser

      @PostMapping("/postRegistryUser") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<String> postRegistryUser(@RequestBody Usuario user) throws com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonProcessingException
      Registers a new user in the system by saving their details to the database.

      This method handles HTTP POST requests to create a new user. It ensures that the user is not already logged in before allowing the registration process. If the user is authenticated and already logged in, a message indicating that the user is already logged is returned. The provided user details (name, email, password, birthdate, school, and studies) are validated, and the user is assigned a default role of "STUDENT". The password is encoded before being stored. If the user details are valid, the user is saved to the database; otherwise, an error message is returned.

      Parameters:
      user - A Usuario object containing the user details to be registered. The object must include the user's name, email, password, birthdate, school, and studies.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity containing a JSON object with the status of the operation: - If the user is already logged in: - "status": "false", "message": "You are already logged!". - If the user details are incomplete or invalid: - "status": "false", "message": "Server didn't receive a user to log". - If the user is successfully registered: - "status": "true". - If there is an error while saving the user: - "status": "false", "message": "Couldn't insert the new user in database".
      Throws:
      com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonProcessingException

    • getAllIdUsers

      @GetMapping("/getAllIdUsers") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<String> getAllIdUsers() throws com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonProcessingException
      Retrieves all users' details from the database.

      This method handles HTTP GET requests to fetch a list of all users from the database. The users are returned in an array format with all available user details. If no users are found, an error message is returned indicating that there are no users in the database. If an error occurs while fetching the users, an error message is returned.

      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity containing a JSON object with the status and user details: - If the users are successfully retrieved: - "status": "true", "array": An array containing all the user details. - If no users are found: - "status": "false", "message": "There are no users in database, this might be an error". - If there is an error fetching the users: - "status": "false", "message": "There was an error in server trying to fetch the users".
      Throws:
      com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonProcessingException

    • getAllIdWorks

      @GetMapping("/getAllIdWorks") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<String> getAllIdWorks() throws com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonProcessingException
      Retrieves all works (or writings) from the database.

      This method handles HTTP GET requests to fetch a list of all works (or writings) stored in the database. The works are returned in an array format. If no works are found, an error message is returned indicating that there are no writings in the database. If an error occurs while fetching the works, an error message is returned.

      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity containing a JSON object with the status and works details: - If the works are successfully retrieved: - "status": "true", "array": An array containing all the works details. - If no works are found: - "status": "false", "message": "There are no Writings in database, this might be an error". - If there is an error fetching the works: - "status": "false", "message": "There was an error in server trying to fetch the writings".
      Throws:
      com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonProcessingException

    • getDeletedUser

      @GetMapping("/getUserDeleted") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<String> getDeletedUser(@RequestParam String id) throws com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonProcessingException
      Deletes a user and their associated comments from the system.

      This method handles HTTP GET requests to delete a user based on their user ID. It first verifies that the provided ID is not null. If the ID is valid, it fetches and deletes all comments associated with the user and then deletes the user itself from the database. If the ID is null or an error occurs during the process, an appropriate error message is returned.

      Parameters:
      id - The ID of the user to be deleted.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity containing a JSON object with the status of the operation: - If the user and their comments are successfully deleted: - "status": "true". - If there is an error during the deletion process: - "status": "false", "message": "Error connecting with server, deleting the user aborted". - If the provided ID is null: - "status": "false", "message": "The id received to delete is empty".
      Throws:
      com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonProcessingException

If the ID is null or an error occurs during the process, an appropriate error message is returned.

      Returns:

    • getWorkToEdit

      @GetMapping("/getWorkToEdit") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<String> getWorkToEdit(@RequestParam Long id) throws com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonProcessingException
      Retrieves the details of a work (writing) to edit based on its ID.

      This method handles HTTP GET requests to fetch the details of a work (writing) from the database based on the provided ID. It returns specific information depending on the type of work (e.g., book or article). If the work is found, the details such as title, author, publication date, type, abstract, and other relevant information are returned. If the work is not found or there is an issue during the process, an appropriate error message is returned.

      Parameters:
      id - The ID (ISBN) of the work (writing) to be retrieved.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity containing a JSON object with the status and work details: - If the work is successfully retrieved: - "status": "true", with fields for title, author, publication date, type, abstract, and other details. - If the work is not found: - "status": "false", "message": "Couldn't find the Writing with isbn: [id]". - If the work does not have a valid type: - "status": "false", "message": "The Writing collected has no type". - If there is an exception while retrieving the work: - "status": "false", "message": "Exception in server getting the writing to edit: [exception details]".
      Throws:
      com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonProcessingException

    • postWorkEdited

      @PostMapping("/postWorkEdited") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<String> postWorkEdited(@RequestBody Obra work) throws com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonProcessingException
      Edits and updates the details of a work (writing) in the database.

      This method handles HTTP POST requests to edit an existing work (writing) based on the provided data. It performs validation on the required fields of the work (ISBN, title, author, editorial, publication date, type, abstract, and themes). If any required field is empty or invalid, the method returns an error message with the missing or incorrect fields. If all fields are valid, the method updates the work in the database. In case of any errors during the saving process, an error message is returned.

      Parameters:
      work - The work (writing) object containing the updated details to be saved.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity containing a JSON object with the status and message: - If the work is successfully edited: - "status": "true". - If any required field is empty or invalid: - "status": "false", "message": "Any writing's field is empty: [list of missing fields]". - If there is an error during the save process: - "status": "false", "message": "There was an error editing the work in server: [error details]".
      Throws:
      com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonProcessingException

    • getSearchWorkList

      @GetMapping("getSearchWorkList") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<String> getSearchWorkList(@RequestParam String search) throws com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonProcessingException
      Searches for works (writings) in the database based on the provided search parameter.

      This method handles HTTP GET requests to search for works (writings) that match the search parameter. The search term is passed as a query parameter. It performs a search on the works based on the provided search parameter using the repository method `findAllParams`. The method returns a list of works that match the search term. If any error occurs during the search process, the method returns an error message.

      Parameters:
      search - The search term used to filter works in the database.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity containing a JSON object with the status and the list of works: - If works are successfully fetched: - "status": "true", "array": [list of works]. - If there is an error during the fetch process: - "status": "false", "message": "There was an error in server trying to fetch the writings".
      Throws:
      com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonProcessingException

    • getSearchUsersList

      @GetMapping("/getSearchUsersList") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<String> getSearchUsersList(@RequestParam String search) throws com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonProcessingException
      Searches for users in the database based on the provided search parameter.

      This method handles HTTP GET requests to search for users that match the search parameter. The search term is passed as a query parameter. It performs a search on the users using the repository method `findAllParams`. The method returns a list of users that match the search term. If any error occurs during the search process, the method returns an error message.

      Parameters:
      search - The search term used to filter users in the database.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity containing a JSON object with the status and the list of users: - If users are successfully fetched: - "status": "true", "array": [list of users]. - If there is an error during the fetch process: - "status": "false", "message": "There was an error in server trying to fetch the users".
      Throws:
      com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonProcessingException

    • getSearchCommentList

      @GetMapping("/getSearchCommentList") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<String> getSearchCommentList(@RequestParam String search) throws com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonProcessingException
      Searches for comments in the database based on the provided search parameter.

      This method handles HTTP GET requests to search for comments that match the search parameter. The search term is passed as a query parameter. The method sanitizes the search term by removing all non-alphanumeric characters before performing the search. It uses the repository method `findAllParams` to search for comments in the database. If any comment is flagged as a banned comment or banned answer, the method retrieves the corresponding user details and constructs a list of `ComentarioPintado` objects.

      Parameters:
      search - The search term used to filter comments in the database. The search term is sanitized to remove any non-alphanumeric characters before performing the search.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity containing a JSON object with the status and the list of comments: - If comments are found and successfully fetched: - "status": "true", "array": [list of comments]. - If no comments are found, an empty array is returned: - "status": "true", "array": []. - If there is an error during the fetch process: - "status": "false", "message": "There was an error in server trying to fetch the comments".
      Throws:
      com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonProcessingException

    • getIsbnChecked

      @GetMapping("/geIsbnChecked") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<String> getIsbnChecked(@RequestParam Long id) throws com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonProcessingException
      Checks if an ISBN is present in the database.

      This method handles HTTP GET requests to verify whether a given ISBN (identified by the `id` parameter) exists in the database. It retrieves all ISBNs from the database and checks if the provided `id` matches any of the ISBNs. The response includes the status of the check, indicating whether the ISBN is present.

      Parameters:
      id - The ISBN to check for existence in the database.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity containing a JSON object with the result of the ISBN check: - "status": "true", if the check was successful. - "present": "true", if the ISBN exists in the database, or "false" if it doesn't. - "status": "false", and an error message if there was an issue during the operation.
      Throws:
      com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonProcessingException

    • postWorkInsert

      @PostMapping("/postWorkInsert") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<String> postWorkInsert(@RequestBody Obra work) throws com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonProcessingException
      Inserts a new work into the database.

      This method handles HTTP POST requests to insert a new work (book or article) into the database. The work is provided in the request body. It checks whether all required fields of the work (ISBN, title, author, abstract, editorial, publication place, type, and publication date) are provided. If any field is missing, it returns an error message. If all fields are valid, the work is saved into the database.

      Parameters:
      work - The Obra object containing the work details to be inserted into the database.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity containing a JSON object: - "status": "true", if the work was successfully inserted. - "status": "false", and an error message if any required field was missing or there was a problem with the database.
      Throws:
      com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonProcessingException
